docs.snippet: Formal inception this week of the Latin American Free Trade Association will represent a significant start on the region's own efforts to strengthen its lagging economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Formal inception this week of the Latin American Free Trade Association will represent a significant start on the region's own efforts to strengthen its lagging economy.

headline.main: COMMON MARKET FOR LATINS READY; Formal Inception of Trade Group This Week Will Mark a Milestone 7 COUNTRIES INVOLVED Additional Nations Have Indicated They Plan to Join Association COMMON MARKET FOR LATINS READY

docs.snippet: It was eleven days ago that Premier Castro told a televised Havana rally that Cuba would "exchange" the 1,241 Cuban rebels captured during the abortive April 17 invasion for United States tractors. He said:

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 19 -- Leaders of the various factions making up Uruguay's two major political parties, the Blancos and the Colorados, are trying to get together on single lists of candidates for the next general election.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 19 -- Leaders of the various factions making up Uruguay's two major political parties, the Blancos and the Colorados, are trying to get together on single lists of candidates for the next general election.
docs.abstract: Factions in Blanco and Colorado parties seek conciliation so that each party can present single list of candidates in '62 elections

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti, May 28 -- The Kennedy Administration's policy of helping only those nations willing and able to help themselves is confronted with an uncomfortable dilemma in Haiti.
docs.lead_paragraph: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti, May 28 -- The Kennedy Administration's policy of helping only those nations willing and able to help themselves is confronted with an uncomfortable dilemma in Haiti.
docs.abstract: US dilemma in continuing aid to regime that apparently will not help itself analyzed; deteriorating conditions described

headline.main: U.S. Dilemma on Haiti; Kennedy Regime Faces Hard Decisions on Continuing Its Aid to Dictatorship

byline.original: By MAX FRANKEL Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 28 -- President Kennedy announced today that Adlai E. Stevenson would leave soon on a three-week tour of South America. Mr. Stevenson's "special mis sion" is evidence of increased Administration efforts to promote hemispheric...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 28 -- President Kennedy announced today that Adlai E. Stevenson would leave soon on a three-week tour of South America. Mr. Stevenson's "special mis sion" is evidence of increased Administration efforts to promote hemispheric unity,weakened as a result of differences over developments in Cuba.
docs.abstract: Kennedy links forthcoming S Amer tour by Amb Stevenson with US efforts to strengthen inter-Amer system; effects of tension over Cuba linked; speculation on US policy trend

headline.main: Stevenson Latin Trip Aims To Offset Cuban Tension; STEVENSON SEEKS U.S.-LATIN UNITY

docs.snippet: Foreign exchange market was moderately active during the past week. British pound sterling was erratic while the Canadian dollar had a steady undertone for most of the sessions, then started to ease toward the close.

docs.snippet: North Americans must not think of Adlai Stevenson's forthcoming trip to South America simply as a "goodwill mission." In the present state of Latin-American ferment and of disturbed relations between that region and the United States such a voyage is...
docs.lead_paragraph: North Americans must not think of Adlai Stevenson's forthcoming trip to South America simply as a "goodwill mission." In the present state of Latin-American ferment and of disturbed relations between that region and the United States such a voyage is as much of a gamble as Vice President Nixon's ill-fated visit to South America in the spring of 1958.

docs.snippet: If only through their strength in numbers, many teams of brothers have shown an ability to establish themselves in the public mind. This bids well for a pair of tart-tongued singing comedians named the Smothers Brothers, now brightening the bill at...
docs.lead_paragraph: If only through their strength in numbers, many teams of brothers have shown an ability to establish themselves in the public mind. This bids well for a pair of tart-tongued singing comedians named the Smothers Brothers, now brightening the bill at the Blue Angel.

headline.main: A Couple of Singing Comedians; Field of Folk Music Is Satirized by Tom and Dick Smothers Brothers Appear on Current Program at Blue Angel
